title: AP Statistics: Hypothesis Testing in Economics
driving_question: How can we use hypothesis testing to make inferences about economic behaviors?
short_background_context: In this mission, we will be exploring the concept of hypothesis testing, a method used in statistics to test the validity of a claim or hypothesis about a population parameter. We will be using a real-world scenario involving a pet supply company that sends out coupons via email. The company is interested in knowing whether these coupons are effective in encouraging customers to make a purchase within 30 days of receiving the email. We will be using the principles of hypothesis testing to help the company make this determination.
tasks: Task 1: Formulate the null and alternative hypotheses for this scenario.
Task 2: Identify the appropriate statistical test for this scenario and explain why it is appropriate.
Task 3: Interpret the results of the statistical test and draw a conclusion.
pre_thinking_prompts: What do you understand about the null and alternative hypotheses?
What factors would you consider when choosing a statistical test?
How would you interpret the results of a statistical test?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on the process of hypothesis testing. What did you learn about formulating hypotheses, choosing a statistical test, and interpreting results?
ai_tutor_prompts: Why did you choose that particular statistical test?
How does the p-value influence your conclusion?
What assumptions are you making in your hypothesis test?
remix_zone: Consider a different scenario where the company is interested in whether customers who receive a $20 coupon are more likely to make a purchase than those who receive a $10 coupon. How would you modify your hypotheses and statistical test for this scenario?
